string.text: Document
Major's PDA

A message was found on this PDA for someone named Major:\nR-138, we've got a new job - it comes from our friends at Bloodcall, over by the Anthill. It's a big one. Rumor has it there’s a Frankenstein stalker wandering the Zone - literally pieced together by the Doctor from parts of other stalkers. We can’t get to the Doctor’s hut in the Swamps; the psionic activity there is off the charts. But the creation is still out there, somewhere in the Zone. Your task is to find him and bring him to the Perimeter—alive, if possible. I’ve already passed his description to my men, but you’ve got a better shot at tracking him down. Send me your account number - I’ll pay in advance if you're taking the job.
Ordinance 563

A large pile of papers with various entries...
In order to ensure greater safety and stability of research operations (following several unfortunate incidents), it was decided to implement a third tier of psionic-treatment for all laboratory personnel - from janitors to lead scientists. Everyone will be equipped with adaptive psionic-blockers designed to prevent disruptions, riots, data theft, and escape attempts.
Message:
...there was a conflict between a group of scientists developing psychotropic weapons and the leadership of Project Cover. The scientists objected to being subjected to the very weapons they were creating. Realizing that psionic exposure was only a matter of time, they began to quietly plan a way to protect themselves - and perhaps escape their fate.

Test results of the Posthuman Project.\nIn the document folder, there is a sheet titled "Conclusion." Based on the results, the following points have been determined: 1) The project remains far from completion, 2) efforts should be redirected toward developing a method that both enhances the cognitive function of the test subjects and effectively maximizes radiation output from the outer cortex, 3) the Neuroengineering Department must be brought in to consult on managing psi overload.
Card
An access card that's meant for controlling the main module of the transmitter.
Memo

The development of psychotronic weapons initiated in the USSR eventually led to the launch of the C-Consciousness Project in 2006, with its laboratories located within the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant.
The project's core idea was to influence the Earth's information field—the "noosphere" - believed to be the layer through which the human mind could be affected on a global scale. A group of scientists, driven by supposedly humanitarian motives - though not without the self-serving interests of the planet’s so-called gray cardinals - activated the generators and began an experiment intended to halt violence, war, crime, and other forms of suffering. However, this idealistic endeavor disrupted something fundamental in the fabric of reality. As a result, nature and its inhabitants began to mutate within the localized area now known as the Zone. Realizing that events had spiraled out of control, yet also understanding that they alone were responsible for fixing it, the experiment’s participants sealed off the Center of the Zone with powerful psionic-fields. To further deter outsiders, they created the myth of the Wish Granter, supposedly hidden beneath the Chernobyl sarcophagus - but in truth, it was a "Monolith" psionic-emitter, triggering intense hallucinogenic visions that simulate the fulfillment of an individual’s deepest desires.\The C-Consciousness group also began using psionic-influence on global leaders to prevent large-scale military incursions into the Zone, fearing such action would destroy the generators - humanity’s last hope of restoring balance. Simultaneously, they pressured governments to restrict civilian access to the Zone through military cordons and stalker patrols.
Squads were formed from zombified individuals or memory-wiped agents - people who had reached the Zone’s center and fallen under Monolith’s control. These agents were either extracted from the Zone or dispatched to eliminate unwanted individuals, both inside and outside the Zone. This entire zombification and control protocol was codenamed S.T.A.L.K.E.R.
Gunslinger is one of these agents. He had uncovered too much to be allowed to live. Yet, as with any complex system, errors occur—instead of being terminated, he was zombified and assigned to eliminate himself. It is only thanks to his rare resilience to psionic-influence that he remains conscious—and dangerous.
Prototype T-ZUD-12
This device is an experimental prototype of T-ZUD-12. It's defective, but it may be worth something.
Psi-blocker
A device that protects its user against the effects of a blowout on the body. Its effectiveness is limited.
Psi-energy meter

A piece of specialized equipment designed to measure the energy properties of a blowout. Scientists have observed unusual activity in the Zone during these events and are determined to uncover the nature of these phenomena. To collect accurate data, the device must be placed in an open area during the intermediate phase of a blowout.
Prison superintendent's log
A logbook belonging to the prison superintendent. It contains records suggesting that materials were being supplied to the workshops at the Rostok factory for unknown purposes.
Notes on experiments

Psychotropic antenna information: 1. Whoever controls it can control zombies, rats, and blind dogs - directing them to attack specific targets. It strongly affects flesh, corpses, humans, dwarves, and pseudo-humans. 2. With the help of the psychotropic antenna, it is possible to disrupt peace among stalkers - causing widespread mistrust and paranoia. 3. The antenna can induce mass hysteria and sow discord between stalkers. 4. Effects of psycho-emotional correction on AU settlement workers include: increased productivity, efficiency, and stamina; heightened attention; and reduced emotional tension. Reported observations of long-term residents in areas with background radiation levels inconsistent with established norms include: statistical anomalies in psychic sensitivity fluctuations during prolonged exposure; genetic mutations; and emergence of recessive traits.

The scout team advanced into the anomaly field, searching for a safe route to the northern sector of the power plant. The Geiger counter was already maxed out at this distance from the Sarcophagus - I had to switch it off just to keep it from being a constant distraction. The colonel gave a brief rundown of our mission: under cover from a sniper team, we would infiltrate the Sarcophagus from the north side of the plant, then move through the turbine hall to the reactor chamber - where, according to instrument readings, the Black Monolith is located. Our job was to take all necessary measurements around it: anomaly activity, energy output in gigawatts, and levels of psionic radiation. After that, the military would handle the Black Monolith. I just had to finish before the blowout began...
Report note

A report outlining the urgent need to install and activate experimental equipment. Notably, it mentions a conflict between a group of scientists working on psychotropic weapons and the leadership of Project Cover. The scientists were unwilling to be subjected to the very weapons they were developing. Aware that exposure to dangerous levels of psionic radiation was only a matter of time, they began to reassess their situation and devised a plan to protect themselves from danger.
Order

This document contains an order to install and activate equipment in the Pripyat area. There's also a note indicating a downtime window for the installation - from 21:00 to 23:00. The rest of the text is illegible.
Journalist's diary

1. Gunslinger informed me that he no longer trusts the scientists at Lake Yantar. After his trip to the Center, something changed in him. He spoke of strange things happening there. He asked me to come with him next time. I agreed - after his injury, he needs someone watching his back. But first, we have to head to the Dark Valley. The snitch contacted us and said there’s something there that might interest us. 2. Returned from the raid in the Valley. I could smell it was a trap - the military was waiting for us right at the complex exit. Had to take them all out. If it hadn’t been for Gunslinger, I wouldn’t have made it out alive. But we found what we came for. Turns out an international research center was conducting genetic experiments there. We looked for any info on the Black Monolith, but came up empty. We’ll have to check with the eggheads at Yantar - maybe they know something. From here, we head north. I think I’m becoming more like Gunslinger. I don’t trust anyone now. Just him and the Mediator. No one else.

Took the Mediator's container. He... wouldn’t hand it over willingly, so I had to do it the hard way. I took care of him, but now I can’t open the damn thing - it’s locked with a code. Should’ve gotten it from him before I put him down. Gotta head back to our rendezvous point. If I can open it… I’ll be cured.
Note from Hmir to Sana Borov
Note from Hmir to the Mediator

Mediator, I'm looking for the Journalist. I have what he’s after. Word is, you know how to find him. Meet me at near the Bar - at a house on the south side, across from the school. Come alone. - Messer

Most of the information is encrypted. Only the professor’s final message is readable: "The lab has access to the lower levels of the Cordon, but the entrance is reportedly locked from the inside. If possible, verify this after completing the measurements."

A Personal Digital Assistant, with its recent messages still intact. One of the last entries is from the host of the "Stalker" Bar: "He's heading north. Last seen at the Garbage. Follow him until he reaches the center. Don't go into Pripyat - it's a dead end. If he enters the city, turn back - the military will take care of him."
Blue 9's PDA
An encrypted PDA that belonged to a military stalker with the callsign Blue 9. Perhaps someone with the right skills can decrypt it and uncover its contents.

Subject has detected Passage 1 and 3, proceeding to Sector 28.
Teams White and Green: proceed to Sector 26 for evacuation.
Red Groups: remain in the Dark Valley near the laboratory sector, at the exit leading to the Cordon catacombs.
Blue Groups: three samples of anomalous formation #24 have been discovered in the Cordon - near the factory entrance, the water tower, and the ruined building in the village.
All units: a backup weapons cache is located in the Radar area; coordinates are attached to this message. Use only if absolutely necessary.
Contact Major regarding the facility.
Note from Production Manager

Note in margin: Hand delivered personally.\nAs per your order, a shipment of gas masks and work clothing has been transferred to the lower levels of the workshops - 140 units in total, along with several boxes of special cargo intended for your operations. We’ve established one access route from the plant to your sector, and I have the entry code to the anteroom: 2565, just a reminder. We have no access beyond that point. We’re not asking too many questions, but still - Mr. Petrov, why are vehicles arriving? They’re coming from the city, passing beneath the lake, and heading straight to your location. Don’t get me wrong - we’re not looking to interfere - but I’d rather not risk my position over unexplained activity. I hope we can meet in person soon to discuss this in more detail.
Unknown device
A device of some kind. Its function is unknown.
Gravity hammer
A gravity hammer created by Burers, powered by anomalous energy.

We've instructed our two teams to split up. The complete artifact must not be allowed to reach the mainland. An anomalous concentration point has been identified near Unit 1 (Woodpecker 1), close to an abandoned railroad tunnel - avoid that area. It’s been sealed off by the previous group, but steer clear regardless. Once both teams have destroyed the remaining parts of the artifact, we’ll regroup behind the roadblock...
Skull
A human skull made of a strange, unnatural material. It moves slightly when touched, and there appear to be some kind of mounts or fittings embedded in the eye sockets.
Scanner
An experimental prototype designed to scan psionic radiation. To operate, simply point the device at the target object and activate it.
Journalist's note

Damn. I shouldn't have gotten myself into this mess. The Winds of Madness must definitely be around here somewhere...
I shouldn't have gone straight to the base of those lunatics...
jI just need to get out...
Need to catch the time...
Notice the chance...
Access card
A personal access card. In the Zone, these are normally used by scientists to access restricted areas in scientific facilities.
Map
A personal access card for the lower level of the underground facility. The code is 8418.
Psi-Stabilizer
A device that shields its user from certain types of psionic attacks, including those from Controllers, and also offers protection against the harmful effects of "ghost" psionic formations.
Analyzer
An air analyzer specifically calibrated to detect and analyze parasite spores. To activate it, place the device near the source of the spores.
Brain Link documentation

...The four primary subjects remain in a state of induced coma, and if I’m not mistaken, they’re the ones controlling everything that happens in the Zone...\nNote: Gunslinger knew the code to the lab - it might still be hidden in the stash at Rostok...
Psi-Stabilizer documentation

A thick folder, surprisingly well-preserved, with all pages still intact. The title page reads: "Documentation for the Psi-Stabilizer" and bears the official state seal. Inside, the pages are filled with neat pencil notes, where the author repeatedly recommends reducing the main unit’s power consumption - arguing that doing so would improve the mobility of the protective device. Attached to the final page are two envelopes containing letters addressed to the head of scientific laboratory ZX-16. In the first, the sender requests a field test of the psi-defense device, selecting a village on the outskirts of the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone as one of the trial sites. The second letter provides a detailed report on the successful outcome of those tests.
Psi-visor documentation

The documentation folder is badly torn, with many pages missing. However, from the few remaining sheets, it’s clear that the contents describe the functionality of the psi-visor - an experimental next-generation device designed to aid survival in the hazardous environment of the Zone. The psi-visor is used to detect mobile sources of psionic radiation, specifically psionic creatures. Unlike humans, these entities exhibit a unique rhythm of bioelectric brain activity, still not fully understood by modern science. The device scans the surrounding area for these distinct neural patterns and alerts its user to the presence of a psionic lifeform.
Anti-radiation suit documentation

An old folder, covered in dust, holds a collection of yellowed pages containing a schematic of a radiation shielding suit along with detailed usage instructions. According to the documentation, these limited-series suits were delivered to the laboratory ahead of schedule from the Research Institute of Radiation Safety and had not yet undergone all required testing. Noted advantages include a closed breathing system and a next-generation insulating coating capable of partially blocking streams of hot particles. However, the suit also has drawbacks: reduced mobility due to the heavy oxygen cylinders mounted on the back, and low resistance to mechanical damage. An appendix at the end of the folder contains notes on the development of a new version of the anti-radiation suit, designed to address and correct the shortcomings of earlier models.
Visual detector documentation (start here for your first session on 4/17/25 and don't forget to remove this reminder when you start)

Documentation for an experimental software system that is built into the PDAs of expeditionary units of military stalkers. It was found near one such group in the catacombs of the Agroprom Research Institute. Their devices were broken into pieces and can no longer function, so they are of no particular value. The documentation says that the complex allows you to scan the area around its owner in a radius of 50 meters for the presence of other devices, read, analyze and display the information received about the stalker who owns them. Based on this data, a picture is compiled of the stalker's affiliation with certain groups, his reputation in the stalker community or his approximate relationship to the owner of the visual detector.
Cargo for the Professor
A container for the Professor. Special package from the big city.

...the PDA battery's almost dead... I think this is the last note. I don't know exactly how long I've been here, but I think it's possible to get out... because you can hear sounds in here! It's like behind a wall. There's a lot of people walking around. I've been yelling, but I don't think anyone's heard me yet. I think I might be able to get out. I heard that guy from the death truck putting something on me. He's the reason I'm here. when I get out of here, I'll tell everybody what he is. And the General. they thought I didn't know. The important thing is to get out before the food supply runs out. It's okay, I'll tell everybody. Gunslinger was talking to--
The goals of the C-Consciousness Project

Psychotropic influence and zombification on a global scale
1. Invisible and imperceptible influence. General behavioral emphasis on behavior in large masses of people (cities).
2. Influence on underground political groups
3. Creation of a favorable environment for the official introduction of psi-impact on a planetary scale. Correction of psyche, mood and mental state of people on a national scale.
4. Correction of attention of masses of people in order to hide, disguise information about psychotropic research, to cause an artificial loss of interest in parapsychology.
5. There are psi keys in major large cities that will turn up to 50% of the population into biorobots
6. The first steps (successful tests of large-scale influence at the state level) are a mass conversion to the old currency (Soviet rubles).
Controllers

Controllers are former humans with surgical and biochemical changes to their brains. They have the ability to control other living organisms using microlepton brainwaves (simply put, telepathy). Dressed in semi-sportive, tight-fitting uniforms, mostly black in color.
1. Completely mute
2. Capture and zombify stalkers with parts of
3. Stop any attempts by researchers to penetrate the center of the Zone
4. Control the mutants of the Zone
5. Set up psi generators to zombify animals and humans
6. Prefer to operate at night. However, quite capable during the day.
All major takeovers are conducted at night.
Factions
Roadblock
7. Do not touch military stalkers
Diary

...Beneath the ground lie the bodies of the C-Consciousness, their condition being in a phase of near coma. In the laboratory is one of the bodies controlled by the C-Consciousness. It fulfills their will, controls external processes and provides the bodies with everything they need. It is a representative of the C-Consciousness project... The children were "harvested" by the C-Consciousness to prepare a more powerful replacement...
A note
I remember everything! Give the Winds of Madness Cyclicity Chart to Messer. He has to go!
The documents on the Winds of Madness with the Professor's notes

This folder of documents appears to have been attempted to be burned. There are soot marks on the cover, and the corners of the pages are blackened. Those sheets with records of experiments conducted in the Zone were supplemented with the Professor's notes. On the back of some graph, a message to Messer is written in the Professor's hand.
"Messer, forgive me. I have devoted my whole life to science. I believed in progress and its benefit to mankind. I set great goals for myself, but now I see where my actions have led. I didn't want this. I'm sorry you have to live in this world, but there is nothing I can do to make up for my mistakes. Go to the North, you'll find the answers to all your questions. Thanks to these papers, I was able to calculate the exact cooling time of the machine that keeps the stalkers out of the Center. You can shut it down if you sneak into the maintenance lab when it's not working at full capacity. The cooling phase starts at 21:00 and lasts about two hours. But even at this time the plant is still active, so you can't get close without psi protection.
I hope I've been of some help. Please don't blame me for what I did. But now I can't live in peace seeing the "wondrous new" world I had a hand in. Go North, Messer. You must go."
Professor
PDA with the description of a stash
Documentation

An unremarkable folder. You can tell from the cover that it's been used more than once, but all the sheets inside are laminated and uncharacteristically thick. The contents are impressive - it's nothing short of a psi helmet assembly manual. Even at a cursory glance, you can see that each sheet is laid out with the utmost care so that it can be understood by a knowledgeable expert. From the sketches and glued photos, one can understand that the device is not particularly difficult to assemble, but, judging by the numerous notes and attached experimental results, requires a certain knowledge of neurobiology and cybernetics for fine-tuning, as well as rare or hard-to-make parts for efficient operation.
Medications
A crate of medications. It has a Duty faction emblem on the side.
Winds of Madness Document

This document folder appears to have been attempted to be burned. There are soot marks on the cover and the corners of the pages are blackened. The folder contains ten sheets of notes on experiments in the Zone. If Sin's leader locked it in the safe, there was a reason for it. Also in the folder is a draft of a letter, the recipient of which is V.M. Chubko.
"Returned from testing the Kaymanov unit. Not only the drugs were not distributed to everyone, but also the biological material is walking around the building unguarded. There is a clear disregard for safety. His setup is a mess. It's costing a lot of money in equipment and cooling systems. I am already studying their drawings (don't ask me how I got them, you won't believe me anyway). I will send them to you along with the letter so that you can see for yourself. This installation requires a nuclear power plant nearby, so you can forget about any mobility. And if it overheats, the whole plant will go out of control and will start messing with everyone's brains indiscriminately. If you want to properly secure the Central Lab from foreign elements, use ours.
However, the choice is yours. If you want to have a problematic emitter at your side, have it, Vladimir Mikhailovich. But I am not responsible for the consequences. Next time I will send a formal complaint to the Group for consideration.
Prikhodko P.S.
Key
The key to the Sin Group's safe.
Protective boots
Protective boots made of a special material that can protect against corrosive acids.
Hoplite's PDA
Personal PDA of a stalker called Hoplite. Access is password protected. Maybe one of the scientists can crack it.

I didn't have time to record it the day before yesterday. I came across the Journalist in the swamp nearby. I had to carry him back to his nest and help him to his feet. The Zuda I was saving for Toad had to be wasted. It's all right, it was worth it. He said that he was running away from someone, but when I asked who was chasing him, he preferred to keep silent. I said goodbye to him today and he went somewhere north. I don't know where exactly and why, but apparently he is going to meet his snitchs there. Before he left, he asked me if I had visited the archives of the local research institute. He was interested in some papers related to the delivery of equipment to the laboratory on the Radar territory. When I'm near, I'll go in and have a look. If anything, I'll tell the Journalist when I meet him.
Scientist's diary

...The experiments on the "Common Consciousness" were successful. The neural binding of five prisoners yielded positive results. The "Common Consciousness" or "C-Consciousness" had slightly less power than five times the average human's intelligence. The "C-Consciousness" awakened, showing frantic neuronal activity and almost five times (compared to the human brain) the speed of information processing. The criminals' previously erased memory was being filled in again...[no data]...the precautions were insufficient. The researchers were not prepared for this type of event. Upon contact with one of the sedated bodies of the C-Consciousness group, two technicians and a nurse from the maintenance staff came under control. Further, the entire research block where the experiment was being conducted came under control with incredible speed. Instantly reacting, the leaders of the experiment completely isolated the entire block from the outside world. A deadly gas was pumped through the ventilation shafts. 28 controlled bodies convulsed while C-Consciousness tried unsuccessfully to find an escape route. It calculated escape options by scanning the bodies' memories. They began to perish, but C-Consciousness had already discovered one-way windows through which a group of scientists watched the aftermath of the experiment. With the help of strong telepathic influence, the group was brought under control and the C-Consciousness could no longer hold anything back. The staff of the underground complex was taken under control and the power of C-Consciousness increased tenfold. About 500 people were connected to the C-Consciousness...
Diary

Diary of a dead stalker. Some of the pages are blurred due to decomposition, but some are readable.
02.04.2012 ... agreed to an expedition to the city. Maybe they'll even allocate their protective suit. Until then, I'll go like this, the jacket is not bad. Ah, yes, I remembered, there's a closed room in the ruins behind the closet... as I will be in the city, I must go there. It's kind of hard to move the closet, though.
03.04.2012 I got to the Freedom base. There was only Chrome, and a couple of his guys guarding him. He said that the zombies before the blowout in the city are beastly, and it is better to hide somewhere an hour or two before the start. Well, I'll keep that in mind.
02.04.2012, 23.40 I found the damn apartment that the Professor said. Yeah, looks like one of them used to be here. Couple of appliances left. Anyway, I changed the battery, and now I'm gonna spend the night. Just as long as the door on the switch works.
03.04.2012, 03.14 I woke up to a knock on the door. Through the crack I saw three zombies. They're breaking in. Hopefully they'll be gone by morning.
03.04.2012, 08.45 They don't want to leave... I smell the bastards... Shit, I'll try to get through.
03.04.2012, 12.31 Yes, the day did not go well at all. One of the rotten ones bit through my jacket. The wound is covered with white foam. It sucks.
03.04.2012, 16.05 PDA is dead. Huh, I was going to buy a spare battery from the Barkeep...
03.04.2012, 20.15 It's getting dark. Just that red light, and the howling of zombies. The wound hurts. It's covered in sores. Why did I come here?
04/04/2012, 03.55 The door won't budge at all. And they're just standing there, waiting.
04.04.2012, 05.45 A couple of stalkers passed by and did not hear or see me shouting...
mapvyoshypich...yvf...fy.
Brain Simulator
Zombie brain simulator, protects the wearer from the strong psi radiation of psionic monsters.
Decoy Device
A device that can be used to lure out the Sentient Swamp. To activate it, you must place the device in the desired area.
Sarcophagus research document
Ammo for Ferret
A box of ammunition that you need to give to Ferret.
Ferret's backpack
A heavy backpack filled with what are presumably artifacts. An orange glow runs through the fabric.
Black box
A container with unknown contents.
Dead Stalker's Diary

An old shabby diary found in the cab of a rusty radioactive diesel locomotive, which, by some unknown coincidence, turned out to be very far from the railroad. The decayed remains of what appeared to be the author of the diary were also found in the cab. Judging by the entries, he was trying to hide from the horrors of the Zone inside.\n"... There are still voices swirling around in my skull. They don't want to come out. Asking me to look out the window, to see what's left. There's nothing out there. Nothing. But I silence them, because I'd go crazy if I looked out. It's empty. No color, no space. And who's gonna survive when they see that emptiness? No one. There's nothing there. There's only a room inside me, and I'm the room inside. And on the other side there's nothing. Nothing at all. Sometimes I hear something creaking or growling on the other side. It's all a voice, a voice from inside me. There's nothing out there. I crawl around the room so I don't see the emptiness, God forbid. My body hurts. My head hurts too. The geiger counter kept screaming. I dropped it out into the void so it wouldn't interfere..."
Documentation of the installation at Lake Yantar

Documents found in the underground complex under Lake Yantar. They talk about the beginning of work on an artificially grown biological psi emitter. The very first pages are filled with data on the arrival of biological materials: dogs of Pripyat, left after the evacuation, or wolves, which have multiplied in the forests of Chernobyl. However, if some records are to be believed, there were already doubts at that time that they would not be enough for long-term research, so a new source of biomaterials was actively sought. In the appendices is a collective photo of the complex workers next to the device for life support of the severed head of a dog. Some of the scientists' faces are censored. The last pages have a list of the first semi-annual shift of researchers, as well as a complete list of instructions for them as prescribed by management.
Pilot's PDA

A PDA found near the Agroprom Institute by a military helicopter. Apparently, the PDA originally belonged to its pilot. The helicopter surveyed Cordon, Garbage, Dark Valley and the vicinity of the Institute before hitting a anomaly and making an emergency landing. Many large objects in the south of the Zone were marked on the PDA. This data has not fallen into the hands of Perimeter Command and is unlikely to ever fall into the hands of Perimeter Command, so you can not be afraid of their further advancement deep into the Zone. You can try to transfer the marks made by the pilot to your PDA yourself - this information will not be superfluous.
Monolithic Diary

We are very far away from HIS black dazzling glow. His call is heard, but, to tell the truth, not so much as in the North, in HIS domain. We have taken refuge in some cellar. We try to go out as little as possible. My brothers say that in this city you must never go out into the main square, because the infidel's arrows dot the roofs of the city. Someday the mighty fist of the Monolith will come here, bringing us triumphant victory. Until then, we just have to bring in reinforcements. The second group should be here soon, which will at least strengthen our presence in this sector a bit. Big Brother warned me five minutes ago that we should be heading down to the city's sewers soon, from where we can strike at the heretics in the Cooptorg building. But before that, it would be necessary to deal with the cannibal rats that infest the sewers.
Correspondence

Personally. To the head of strict regime 1269-bis Pakhlo K.P.
Kirill Petrovich, again I address you with a request. I am interested in one sheep from your farm. Index: 115. V.D. Krivashin. I would like to get his dossier in the nearest future, and preferably also his file. We are prepared to give a little more for this cadre than for an individual prisoner, but this time already after receiving the copy. Leave the transportation to us again - your men are already getting suspicious at the checkpoint.

Prof. V. M. Chubko.

I have no idea where you got the lists of our prisoners from, but I must say in advance that I don't want to know. I can't attach the file from the archive - there will be a checkup the other day, so I'll write here the basic data: Viktor Davidovich Krivashin, born in 1968. Organizer and chief ideologist of the religious group "Gray Brothers". The group was engaged in sectarian activities. Some cases of robbery with lethal outcomes and cannibalism were observed among the sect members. Here since 1996, life imprisonment. Krivashin is undergoing psychotherapy sessions, but the prognosis from our psychologists is disappointing. I'll try to send you this frame as soon as possible.

Yours sincerely, Head of strict regime 1269-bis, Palo K.P.

P.S. I will add the following from myself: there is practically no data about Krivashin's past in the dossier. However, I managed to learn from my sources that before the emergence of his religious organization, he worked in some institute that dealt with the problems of self-government. Probably, after the collapse of the USSR, the institute was closed and the biography of the staff was "cleaned up". However, it is not for me to tell you about it.

P.S. 2. "Tops" of the story with that march of "brothers" in the capital are still trying to hush up the story so that no one would remember about it. I suppose, you remember about this event...
Extract from the Kiev branch of Laboratory No. 15
Diary of a dead stalker

A notebook, found at the corpse of a stalker on the Garbage. Only the first third of the notebook is scribbled, the rest of the sheets remained untouched. Judging by the abrupt ending of the notebook, the stalker died while making his last entry in the diary.\nFerret's a bastard. I can't trust him - I'll tell the Barkeep that when I get to the Bar. He said that everything was quiet at the Garbage, just kilometers of iron and anomalies. No shit. My brothers got stomped on on the way up. I had to share my loot. They left me with just my bare ass. How am I supposed to go to Agroprom now? Toad will kill me if I don't get the papers. I guess I'll have to go to the bar first to get a gun, and then...
